titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:30

did.unittitle: Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, photographs, artwork, and other papers by or relating to Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gifts and bequest of Donald Windham, 1989-2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 66 (audiovisual materials): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Donald Windham
bioghist.p: Donald Windham (1920-2010) was an American novelist and memoirist. He collaborated with Tennessee Williams on the play You Touched Me! Windham was the partner of Sandy Campbell from 1943 until Campbell's death in 1988.

bioghist.head: Sandy Campbell
bioghist.p: Sandy Campbell was an American actor and publisher of the Stamperia Valdonega in Verona press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings, correspondence, photographs, artwork, and other papers by or relating to Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight groupings: December 1989 Acquisition, April 1990 Acquisition, November 1991 Acquisition, May 1993 Acquisition, November 1993 Acquisition, December 1997 Acquisition, December 1999 Acquisition, and May 2011 Acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with Donald Windham, Fred Melton, Sandy Campbell and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence from Graham Greene and Graham Greene's secretary to Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell. Also contains correspondence from Donald Windham to Graham Greene.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a holograph of the E.M. Forster introduction to the book "The Warm Country" by Donald Windham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters and postcards to Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell, as well a letter to Lincoln [Kirstein] from Christopher Isherwood. Also contains a typed copy on carbon paper of the poem "On his Queerness" by Christopher Isherwood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters to Donald Windham and Sandy Campbell. Also contains a letter from Julie Fallowfield to Donald Windham (1984 December 4).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters and postcards to Donald Windham. Also contains a letter from Donald Windham to Paul Bowles, and a letter from Daniel Halpern to Donald Windham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into four groupings: Alphabetical, Sandy Campbell and Donald Windham, Chronological by year, and Postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence consists of incoming and outgoing letters.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Audiovisual material. Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
